alert.note: Alert for Kuskokwim Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued January 23 at 4:45AM AKST until January 23 at 5:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM AKST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions occurring. Northeast winds 35 to 40 mph gusting as high as 50 mph. Visibility reduced to one quarter mile at times. Wind chills as low as 30F to 50F below zero. * WHERE...Kuskokwim Delta coast. * WHEN...Until 5 PM AKST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The dangerously cold wind chills as low as 50 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The worst conditions are occurring along the coast. Winds will very slowly diminish throughout the day, which may allow for gradually improving conditions, with intermittent breaks of higher visibility. Visibilities as low as one half mile are still possible at inland locations within the Kuskokwim Delta, including Bethel. Blowing snow will continue to reduce visibility as low as one half mile across the Kuskokwim Delta through Monday evening while 25 to 35 mph northeasterly winds persist. Conditions will begin to improve more substantially tonight as winds start to diminish more quickly.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel very hazardous. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you.If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle.
